intro: Stichorkis acaulis, commonly known as the barren-stemmed stichorkis, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic and edible plants. The plant is characterized by its lack of a distinct stem, with leaves forming a dense rosette near the ground. Its small, yellowish flowers are clustered in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. Stichorkis acaulis is often found in rocky or dry soils, thriving in sunny to partially shaded environments.
